aristaeus: Whose pursuit of Eurydice led to her death
father: in most traditions) or Oeagrus (King of Thrace)
dionysus: (in some versions) Who incited the Maenads against him

name: Greek Mythology
attributes: Son of Apollo/Oeagrus and Calliope, Prophet of the Mysteries, Prince of Thrace, The Enchanter
Music, poetry, prophecy, mysteries, healing through song, eloquence
Lyre (seven-stringed), laurel wreath, tortoise (lyre's shell origin)
All creatures were subject to his music—lions, serpents, birds, even the beasts of the wild
Thrace, Lesbos (where his head washed ashore), various Orphic temples

even the beasts of the wild
